current.airweave_advanced_faq_question_1: What's the difference between your two mattress models?
current.airweave_advanced_faq_answer_1:
There are 3 main differences. 
1. Advanced model is modular and assembly is required. It‚Äôs good for frequent movers and makes it easy to carry and clean. Also ships via FedEx instead of freight.
2. Advanced features 1 block (mattress core is 3 pieces) that is DUAL MODE. This block has a firm and regular side and is meant to be used in the center of the mattress. The firm side will feel firmer than the airweave Mattress and will provide the most back support and spinal alignment.
3.  The Advanced also comes with a pillow top layer that can add a bit of a soft, plush feel.
current.airweave_advanced_faq_answer_2: Soft on one side, firm on another. Our DUAL MODE technology allows anyone to adjust their sleeping surface for a completely custom recovery, which means you‚Äôll wake up feeling your best. The one (1) DUAL MODE block for the airweave advanced was designed to be placed in the middle to give your hips and back the proper support it needs, or see what's right for your body and place as desired.
current.airweave_advanced_faq_question_3: How long does it take to ship the airweave Advanced?
current.airweave_advanced_faq_answer_3: We offer FREE standard shipping for this mattress model and delivery takes 3-10 business days. You'll receive a tracking number once available. Orders ship Fedex and UPS and delivery cannot be scheduled in advanced.
current.airweave_advanced_faq_question_4: How does airfiber¬Æ wear over time?
current.airweave_advanced_faq_answer_4:
Gradually over time, airfiber¬Æ, our mattress core material, will soften up a little bit with use. You should expect a slight conforming to your body, which is natural for our product, over years of regular use. You should not see any major deterioration or ever experience deep indents or that ‚Äúsinking in‚Äù feeling.
A note about our warranty and deterioration:
We have conducted pressure tests on our mattresses for individuals up to 220lbs. At this weight or lower, you should expect to use these models for 3 years or more and only see natural indentations. For any individuals above 220lbs you may see body indents and wear sooner.

current.mattress_faq_question_4: I want the product that helps me sleep the best. Which should I choose?

Sleep is very personal and so depending on your personal needs, one may be a better choice over the other. We do assure customers that all of our airweave products provide the benefits of a firm, supportive, and cool sleep surface.

Our toppers are effective in improving a soft mattress that you're not ready to dispose of. If it's in good condition you can use our topper and enjoy a firmer, cooler sleep surface.

Our mattresses are firm, supportive and cool. If you are looking for a 9/9.5 on the firmness scale and need to replace your entire mattress this this the product for you.

If you're traveling and looking for an easy to carry mattress topper to ensure a consistent, comfortable sleep from airweave, then our Portable options were made for you!

current.dog-bed_faq_question_1: What size dog bed should I buy?
current.dog-bed_faq_answer_1:
How does your four-legged friend like to sleep? Curled in a ball or stretched out on their side or stomach? We'd recommend measuring the longest dimension in their sleep positions to find the perfect size. Here are some general suggestions too:
Small (20" x 26") fits most dogs up to 40 lbs and comfortably fits breeds such as Beagle, Dachshund, French Bulldog, Shiba Inu, small Terriers and Spaniels.
Medium (23.5" x 36") will fit dogs 40-60 lbs and comfortably fit breeds such as Standard Poodle, Husky, English Bulldog, large Shiba Inu (like our model Masaru) smaller Labradors and Pitbulls.
Large (27.6" x 47.6") will fit most dogs up to 110 lbs and comfortably fit breeds such as German Shepherd, Doberman, Rottweiler, large Retrievers, Labradors, and Pitbulls.
current.dog-bed_faq_question_2: How do I wash the dog bed?
current.dog-bed_faq_answer_2:
Machine wash the cover and pillow top layer cold. Hang dry.
Rinse the airfiber with cool water and mild soap in a bath tub or hose down outside. Air dry out of direct sunlight.

settings.heading: About The Ritz Paris Collection
settings.text: To celebrate the renovation and reopening of the Ritz Paris, airweave signed an exclusive partnership to design two travel-friendly mattress models for the legendary hotel on Place Vend√¥me. The collaboration is an extension airweave‚Äôs existing relationship with the Ritz Paris, which offers guests the option to request an airweave Top Mattress for their room. ‚ÄúEntering this partnership with the Ritz Paris that exemplifies innovation and expertise was a natural progression. We share the same values.‚Äù - Motokuni Takaoka, airweave Founder and CEO.

settings.landing-page-template-1-hero-content-tex: We take a 360¬∞ approach to environmental responsibility by designing a product with a lower carbon footprint and less waste than most traditional mattress brands.

settings.landing-page-template-1-info-subheading-: Our proprietary airfiber¬Æ material is made of linear low density polyethylene (LLDPE), a material that can endure the strictest test in the field of durability, safety, hygiene and environmental friendliness.
settings.landing-page-template-1-info-item-1-text: LLDPE is in a family of polyethelyne plastics that are the safest. It's food grade and nontoxic.
settings.landing-page-template-1-info-item-2-text: It is an efficient raw material. When using LLDPE to create airfiber¬Æ and other products, the emission of harmful substances and waste is minimal.
settings.landing-page-template-1-info-item-3-text: It is highly suitable for recycling. LLDPE is a thermoplastic material which means that it can be melted unlimited times to make new products.

settings.landing-page-template-1-info-conclusion-: Airweave has commissioned a study of our total carbon footprint based on research and data modeling conducted by Carbon Footprint Ltd. By looking at our total CO2 emissions, from manufacturing to disposal, we're able to see the impact of using our lightweight airfiber material vs. traditional mattress materials can be to reduce emissions and be better for the planet.

settings.landing-page-template-1-addt-info-item-1: Our factory uses less energy. The formation process of airfiber¬Æ occurs at a low temperature, unlike springs or foam which require high heat.
settings.landing-page-template-1-addt-info-item-2: Reducing weight of cargo is the #1 way to combat increasing emissions in our air. airweave is 30% lighter than most mattresses which means less fuel and emissions are put into the air.

settings.landing-page-template-1-info-message-con: Over the course of a year Americans dispose of 20 million mattresses in landfills. That's approximately 460 million cubic feet of waste. There is no other mattress than airweave that has a 100% recyclable core material.

settings.landing-page-template-1-info-process-con: airweave proves to be good for both people and the planet. Our airfiber¬Æ mattress cores are made of a 100% recyclable material which can be easily melted down and repurposed into new goods. Learn about the steps below.
settings.landing-page-template-1-info-process-ite: Used airfiber¬Æ is collected and transferred to a recycling facility to be broken down by what's called a fracturing process.
The fractured material is then melted down and goes through an extrusion and cooling process.
This creates the pellets which will then be sent off to new factories to be re-melted and molded...
...transforming airfiber¬Æ into everyday household products. We use recycled airfiber¬Æ for our packaging.

Love the texture and firmness.
settings.review-content-3: We love our new Airweave mattress. It really is firm. No bouncing when one of us rolls over. It is also the coolest mattress ever.

We're proud to support the USA Triathlon team and offer members an exclusive savings.

settings.landing-page-template-2-info-subheading-: airweave's line of innovative mattresses are chosen for their supportive, breathable design by top athletes & professionals to accelerate recovery and help them perform at the highest level.
settings.landing-page-template-2-info-item-1-text: Supportive from every angle. The firm, resilient feel of our products provides the support you need for optimal spinal posture and can provide pressure and pain relief many experience from a soft mattress.
settings.landing-page-template-2-info-item-2-text: Designed to breathe. Compared to memory foam, airweave can significantly lower your core body temperature thanks to its breathable design. This means you'll enjoy a deeper more restorative sleep.
settings.landing-page-template-2-info-item-3-text: Sleep is an active state. But when you exert less energy at night, you wake up feeling more refreshed. Airweave allows for ease of movement and very low level of motion transfer so you stay in a deep sleep. You'll feel like you're floating on air and not sinking into your mattress.

settings.review-content-1: Your unique design and material combination provides excellent airflow, eliminating hot spots or other undesirable points of contact. Because of its unique surface design, it is an excellent cost-effective alternative to purchase of an entire mattress for those in need of an updated sleeping surface. I would highly recommend this product to anyone looking for a firm comfortable sleeping surface.
settings.review-content-2: I love my new airweave topper. The neutral even surface is perfect to distribute pressure points along my spine and I'm waking up feeling good. It took about a year to find the right sleep surface, and so glad I did.
settings.review-content-3: Normally, it might take me a couple of days to get rid of minor soreness, but when I woke up from my deep sleep with airweave, I was pain-free, rested, and ready to go.
settings.review-content-4: I‚Äôve recently herniated a disk in my back and also have a bulging disk from diving so getting quality sleep has become very important. Its a relief mentally and physically knowing I will be getting quality sleep in Rio and for that, I thank you.

settings.landing-page-template-2-info-conclusion-: How Triathlete Ross McGraw Gets Everything Done

Ross McGraw is an internationally ranked Team USA Triathlete who races and trains around the world. All while maintaining a successful career in marketing in New York City. How does he adapt to a life of ever-changing time zones? ‚ÄúI rely on cycles to keep my life in order," he says, "and naps.‚Äù Click to read more

settings.landing-page-template-3-hero-content-tex: Airweave was founded on the principle that it's not about what you feel when you get into bed that makes the mattress, it's about how you feel when you wake up. So we take a scientific approach to everything we do to make sure our products provide The Quality Sleep so you feel better the next day.

settings.landing-page-template-3-info-process-con: We've all seen mattress brands tout scientific research in their advertising but airweave's sleep research is the only of its kind to be accepted by medical journals. It is a testament to our work to design innovative, effective mattresses.
settings.landing-page-template-3-info-process-ite: The study published in Scientific Reports showed that sleeping on airweave‚Äôs high rebound mattress toppers improved athletic performance. The results suggest selecting optimal sleep surfaces may contribute to the maximization of athletic performances.
Core Body Temperature Drop Enhances Deep Sleep
The study, which shows airfiber¬Æ can lower core body temperature and improve sleep quality more than memory foam, is the first of its kind to be published by the Public Library of Science PLOS ONE.
Longer lasting decrease in core body temperature was seen in subjects sleeping on airweave than those sleeping on memory foam.

settings.landing-page-template-3-addt-info-item-1: From our 2011 research at the Ota Memorial Sleep Center, we compared body temperature measurements throughout the night of subjects sleeping on airweave and on memory foam. The results show that sleeping on airweave lowered the core body temperature faster and kept the subject cooler throughout the night.
settings.landing-page-template-3-addt-info-item-2: As we found that airweave promoted a greater reduction of the core body temperature at the Ota Memorial Sleep Center,  results also suggest that this cooler state of sleep promoted time spent in a deeper state of sleep when compared to memory foam. Deep, restorative sleep provides the recovery your body needs to perform at its best.
settings.landing-page-template-3-addt-info-item-3: As we found that airweave promoted a greater reduction of the core body temperature at the Ota Memorial Sleep Center,  results also suggest that this cooler state of sleep promoted time spent in a deeper state of sleep when compared to memory foam. Deep, restorative sleep provides the recovery your body needs to perform at its best.

settings.landing-page-template-5-hero-content-tex: Choosing a new sleep surface could be the answer to relieving your back and joint pain. See why airweave's firm and supportive line of mattresses might be the right choice so you wake up with less pain.

settings.landing-page-template-5-info-heading-tex: A Study Of Spinal Posture On Varying Sleep Surfaces
settings.landing-page-template-5-info-subheading-: Dr. Koji Kanoka is an orthopedic surgeon and professor of sports sciences at Waseda University in Tokyo. Dr. Kanoka has been involved in the education & research of sports medicine and served as a doctor of the JOC HQ for the London Olympics. He specializes in athlete's lower back pain prevention research, is a leading researcher in deep muscle trunk research, and a published author on these subjects.
settings.landing-page-template-5-info-item-1-text: "I have received many complaints from top athletes competing around the globe that the hotel beds are too soft that they sink in, or their lower back hurts when they wake up in the morning. These observations apply to anyone who feels pain when they "arch" their back or when sleeping on a soft surface. When this happens, doctors will often recommend trying a firmer surface, sleep on their side, or place a pillow below their knees to give support to their back.
settings.landing-page-template-5-info-item-2-text: It is well known that many people feel the pain stronger when arching their back, but no one has conducted any scientific analysis on how mattress affects one's spine alignment. So we took an MRI of the lower back when sleeping on different surfaces - soft mattress, airweave Top Mattress, and the floor (no mattress). We found that the angle of sacrum gets steeper on a soft mattress than on airweave top mattress or on the floor which means more arching caused by the hip sinking into the soft mattress.
settings.landing-page-template-5-info-item-3-text: We see that a natural posture is maintained on the airweave Top Mattress.  These findings suggest that airweave may help prevent lower back pain with better lower back support, keeping lower back arching minimum, when compared to a softer mattress."

settings.landing-page-template-5-info-message-hea: The Best Mattress For Spine Alignment
settings.landing-page-template-5-info-message-con: The airweave Mattress was graded a perfect 10 for spinal alignment by the review site Mattress Advisor and was named "The Best Mattress For Spine Alignment" for 2018!

settings.landing-page-template-5-info-process-ite: Experience allover support that aligns your spine and improves sleep posture.
Give your muscles a rest while sleeping thanks to the supportiveness of airfiber¬Æ

settings.landing-page-template-5-info-conclusion-: Support From Every Angle Relieves Pressure

The resilient, three-dimensionally woven airfiber¬Æ core in every airweave product gently supports you from every angle and distributes your weight evenly. This minimizes pressure points and reduces physical strain while sleeping so you wake up feeling invigorated.

settings.caption: Founded in 1906, Kagaya is a traditional Japanese style inn known as a Ryokan. Kagaya has been voted #1 for 36 consecutive years as the "Top 100 Hotels & Ryokans."
Guests are treated with the Kagaya tradition of "heartfelt hospitality" in the form of impeccable services, gourmet dining and premium facilities.
Located in Wakura-onsen, Kagaya is surrounded by beautiful nature landscape and an abundance of hot springs.
airweave futons are featured in all the rooms so guests can experience the best night sleep possible. Shown here is our shikibuton (airweave Futon) and kakebuton (Hyperdown Duvet)

settings.heading: The Futon Tradition
settings.text: Not to be confused with the American version of a futon sofa bed, the futons of Japan are traditional bedding made up of two separate parts: the shikibuton (mattress) and the kakebuton (duvet or blanket). Traditionally, futons are used on tatami mats to provide a softer base than a hard floor.  Futons are made to be easily folded and stored during the day to allow other uses for the room. Traveling to Japan and looking to immerse yourself in traditional surroundings? Try the Kagaya hotel in Ishikawa. Scroll photos to learn more.

settings.landing-page-template-6-hero-content-tex: The Futon is thick enough to use on it's own, or used as a mattress topper for a plush, luxurious feel with all the benefits of airfiber¬Æ. An all-weather outer cover features a velvety soft side for cooler days and a breathable thin layer on the other side for when it's hotter. Easily folds and has handles to carry.

settings.landing-page-template-6-info-heading-tex: Backed By Science To Improve Your Sleep
settings.landing-page-template-6-info-subheading-: Our Founder, Motokuni Takaoka created our Futon to satisfy a need for a special sleep surface that would help his aches and pains due to a car accident. Using his Uncle's fishing line factory, he re-engineerd the machines to create this unique material we call airfiber¬Æ.
settings.landing-page-template-6-info-item-1-text: Supportive from every angle. The firm, resilient feel of our products provides the support you need for optimal spinal posture and can provide pressure and pain relief many experience from a soft mattress.
settings.landing-page-template-6-info-item-2-text: Designed to breathe. Compared to memory foam, airweave can significantly lower your core body temperature thanks to its breathable design. This means you'll enjoy a deeper more restorative sleep.
settings.landing-page-template-6-info-item-3-text: Sleep is an active state. But when you exert less energy at night, you wake up feeling more refreshed. Airweave allows for ease of movement and very low level of motion transfer so you stay in a deep sleep. You'll feel like you're floating on air and not sinking into your mattress.

settings.landing-page-template-6-info-conclusion-:
Interested in the full mattress and duvet set? Our Hyperdown Duvet makes the perfect companion to the Futon to optimize your comfort.
USE CODE: FUTON200 AT CHECKOUT

settings.question: What's the difference between your mattress models?
settings.answer:
1. The New Airweave Mattress is 8" thick, softer, and ships in 2 boxes so assembly is required. Comes with 3 airfiber® pieces, pillow top layer and 2 covers

2. The New Airweave Mattress Advanced is 11" thick, has 3 different firmness options with all three modular pieces having a different firmness level on either side (DUAL MODE), and ships in 3 boxes so assembly is required.  DUAL MODE technology lets you choose your firmness for your lower back to achieve proper spine alignment for all body types. Comes with 2 DUAL MODE Moderate/Soft airfiber® pieces and 1 DUAL MODE Moderate/Firm airfiber® piece, 2 pillow top layer, and 2 covers

3. The Mattress Advanced is 8.5" thick, has 2 firmness options (DUAL MODE), and ships in 2 boxes so assembly is required. DUAL MODE technology lets you choose your firmness for your lower back to achieve proper spine alignment for all body types. Comes with 2 regular firmness airfiber® pieces, 1 DUAL MODE airfiber® piece, 1 pillow top layer, and 2 covers

4. The airweave Mattress is our older model that is 8.5" thick, firm, and ships in 1 box via freight. It does not have 3 airfiber® pieces like the New Airweave and Advanced.

Click here to see direct comparisons of all our different mattress models.

settings.question: What's the difference between the Top Mattress and Top Mattress Luxe?
settings.answer:
- The Top Mattress is our base model that’s perfect for anyone looking to add additional support, firmness, and breathability to their existing mattress. 

- The Top Mattress Luxe is our higher-end mattress topper model with softer airfiber® at the shoulders making it great for side sleepers.

- The Top Mattress has a removable outer cover made of a breathable mesh. 

- The Top Mattress Luxe has a removable outer cover with 2 different sides: one for cooler weather that is made of a quilted brushed poly/cotton, and the other is a breathable mesh for when it’s hotter. 

- The Top Mattress airfiber® core thickness is 1.8", and has a total thickness of 2.0” with the outer cover on. 

- Top Mattress Luxe: airfiber® core thickness is 1.4", and has a total thickness of 2.4" with the outer cover on.

Click here to see direct comparisons of all our Top Mattress models.

settings.question: Can the Top Mattress or Top Mattress Luxe be used as a standalone Sleep Surface?
settings.answer: We don't recommend using either model be used directly on the floor or bed frame as the airfiber® material may deteriorate faster and will not be covered under our 10 year warranty.  We recommend the airweave Futon for anyone looking for a standalone mattress alternative.

settings.question: Up to what individual body weight is ideal for an airweave?
settings.answer: We have tested our mattresses for individuals up to 220lbs. At this weight or lower, you should expect to use your mattress for 10-15 years. For any individuals above 220lbs you may see body indents and wear sooner

settings.question: What type of bed frame do you recommend?
settings.answer: airweave mattresses and toppers can work on any type of bed frame with the exception of adjustable beds. Having tried a lot of types ourselves at the airweave HQ, we prefer the platform bed frame the most. If you like a firm sleep surface (9/9.5 on the firmness scale) pick a platform frame with a solid surface. If you would like the feel to be a little softer (8.5 on the firmness scale) find a platform bed with slats (but make sure there's not too much space in between each slat) to provide just a little more give.

settings.question: Does airweave work on an adjustable bed?
settings.answer: Our Mattress, Mattress Advanced, New Airweave Mattress, and New Airweave Mattress Advanced are not suitable for adjustable beds. Our material will not conform to the frame if in a high seated position. Toppers may see faster deterioration if in a bent position over extended amounts of time.

settings.question: Does airweave require a box spring?
settings.answer: No a box spring is not required but can certainly be used if you'd like.

settings.question: Are your mattresses flame retardant?
settings.answer:
Yes. All of our mattresses have passed rigorous testing to prove flame retardant. Like most major sleep product brands, our Mattress contains the necessary flame retardant chemicals required by law to pass the testing. Our Top Mattress, Top Mattress Luxe, Futon and Portable models do not contain any additives to the material in order to pass flame retardant tests.

Flame retardants are a key component in reducing the devastating impact of fires on people, property and the environment.

settings.question: Is there any off-gassing or smell to the products?
settings.answer: There is no off-gassing that occurs from our products. If there is any smell, possibly from the packaging, it should dissipate within 48 hours.

settings.question: Should I use a mattress protector?
settings.answer: No, we do not recommend. Adding an extra layer may limit the benefits of airweave's breathability. In addition, our mattress covers can be easily removed and machine washed and the airfiber® core can be rinsed with cool water.

settings.question: Should I flip my mattress?
settings.answer:
The airweave Mattress is composed of 2 layers of airfiber® stacked on top of another. The top layer is softer than the bottom - something that you should be able to tell by just pressing down on each airfiber® layer with your hand. Since they are different firmnesses, each individual layer can be flipped but you should not flip the entire mattress or else it will be firmer. 

The airweave Mattress Advanced is composed of 3 blocks. The airfiber® blocks located at the head and the foot of the bed can be flipped. The center DUAL MODE airfiber® block has a 'firm' and 'regular' side so flipping this piece will provide a different feel. 

Similar to the airweave Mattress Advanced the New airweave Mattress comes in three block pieces but they do not have different firmness levels on either side so rotating any of the block pieces will not change your mattress set up.

While we do recommend rotating the New airweave Mattress Advanced please note that all three block pieces of the mattress have different firmness levels on either side (DUAL MODE) and may change the feel of your sleep surface.  We suggest that when or if you do rotate the New airweave Mattress Advanced to test out the new set up to make sure it is to your liking.

settings.question: Can I use an electric blanket?
settings.answer: No, we do not recommend. Being that our core material is made of plastic, you might cause damage with the heat from an electric blanket.

settings.question: How should I store my Futon or Toppers?
settings.answer: Our Futon and both Top Mattress models fold into thirds making it easy to store. Please note that if you plan to store either product for extended periods of time that you may begin to see indentations at the folds of the product. This is natural and is to be expected if in a bent position and will not be covered under warranty. Do not place heavy object on top.

settings.question: Any tips to help me adjust to an airweave mattress better?
settings.answer: If it is feeling too firm, a very affordable mattress pad can be added to the mattress while your body adjusts. This recommendation comes directly from customers and was part of the reason we created the airweave Mattress Advanced. You may find that the cooling benefits diminish slightly but you'll feel more comfortable. During your 100 night trial we recommend testing out new sleep positions and eliminate any bad habits. Sleeping on your back (known to be the healthiest sleep position) and side are the most popular sleep positions for our customers.

settings.question: Will airweave remove my old mattress?
settings.answer: Airweave does not offer removal service of your old mattress unfortunately. If you cannot arrange or easily dispose of with your regular trash service, we recommend calling 1800-Got-Junk. Mention airweave for a 10% discount.

settings.question: How does airweave keep me in a deeper sleep?
settings.answer:
There are many factors that go into what might be preventing you from getting the best sleep possible. One of those, which we may not even realize, is that you may be using too much energy when turning while asleep (yes we are still using energy while we sleep!). If you have a mattress that you're sinking into, then you're using more energy which could wake you up at night. Or maybe you're partner is moving and you're waking up from their motion transfer. Our mattress has been designed to provide you ease of movement and very low level of motion transfer through our highly resilient and extra supportive material that has you feeling like you're floating on top rather than sinking.

Waking up at night due to feeling too hot, hotspots on your mattress or even too cold? Airweave has a highly breathable design that allows natural airflow and helps regulate your core body temperature. We've tested airweave against memory foam and have shown that airweave can significantly lower your core body temperature which means you feel comfortable all night. For more information click here: https://www.airweave.com/pages/sleep-study-core-body-temperature-improved-performance

settings.question: How does airweave regulate body temperature?
settings.answer: airfiber® disperses body heat and the heat of a blanket thanks to the unique ability to allow airflow through the material. Airweave gets rid of the usual problem of uncomfortable hotspots that most mattresses generate. Control the temperature of your overall sleep environment with the blankets you choose. During the winter, add a warmer blanket to hold in warmer, dispersed air. For warmer months, use a lightweight blanket and you'll enjoy a cooler airflow.

settings.question: Will airweave help relieve lower back pressure, aches & pains?
settings.answer: For some, airweave has shown to improve users' quality sleep by eliminating aches and pains through ease of pressure and improved spinal alignment. Before trying airweave, we strongly recommend you consult with a medical professional about your symptoms. If you find that a firmer, supportive sleep surface is what you need to relieve pressure and pain, then airweave is the solution for you! For more information visit: https://www.airweave.com/pages/mattress-for-back-joint-pain

settings.question: What makes airweave eco-friendly?
settings.answer:
By design, airweave has a lower carbon footprint and less waste than most traditional mattress brands. For more information visit: https://www.airweave.com/pages/eco-friendly-mattress

- inner core material is made of one of the safest and most suitable for recycling plastics

- during production, less energy is needed to form our mattress and emission of harmful substances and waste is minimal 

- airweave is very lightweight, which means its more efficient less polluting to transport

- we work to ensure that every airweave mattress we dispose of is either recycled or donated and not thrown into a landfill!

- With the airweave Mattress Advanced, you're investing in a mattress that you can keep for a lifetime because we offer the ability to purchase replacement parts rather than require you to throw away your old mattress and purchase an entirely new mattress. That's a win for your wallet and the environment.

settings.question: What is airfiber¬Æ?
settings.answer:
airfiber® is the newest innovation in sleep surface technology.

1. Proprietary technology that enhances recovery during sleep through high rebound & resilience.

2. The unique core material used in all airweave products.

3. Adds benefits like easy/natural turnover, even distribution of weight, dispersion of body heat to help keep you in a deeper more restful sleep.

settings.question: What is the material makeup of airfiber¬Æ?
settings.answer:
airfiber® is made of food-grade polyethylene.

All products are BPA FREE and hypo-allergenic.

settings.question: How do I wash my airweave product?
settings.answer:
- The cover may be washed in a household washing machine.
- Dry in a well-ventilated area out of direct sunlight.
- Avoid hanging out to dry for long periods.
- Do not place covers in a dryer or iron.
- Wash inner airfiber® with lukewarm water below 40C/104F by hand
- Do not wash airfiber® in the washing machine.
- Dry in a well-ventilated area out of direct sunlight.
- Learn more about our 100% washable products here: https://www.airweave.com/pages/the-cleanest-mattress-on-earth

settings.question: How do I place an order?
settings.answer: You can place an order at www.airweave.com. You will receive an email confirming your order that includes your order number. If you prefer to order by phone, please call us at 1-800-407-1500 from 9 AM - 5 PM EST Monday - Friday.

settings.question: What should I do if I am having trouble placing an order?
settings.answer: For any technical difficulties you are experiencing with our website, please contact our online call center at 1-800-407-1500 from 9 AM - 5 PM EST Monday - Friday.

settings.question: What payment methods can I use to place an order?
settings.answer: www.airweave.com accepts major credit cards such as Visa, MasterCard, JCB, and American Express. We are unable to accept international credit cards for online purchases. These payment methods could change in the future without notice.

settings.question: Why are prices different now than when I made my purchase?
settings.answer: All prices and availability of products are subject to change without notice. We make every effort to provide you the most accurate, up-to-the-minute information on pricing and availability. However, some of the items on our website may be mis-priced or no longer available at the time you place your order.

settings.question: Is your company address a showroom?
settings.answer: No! Unfortunately we don't have our own showroom but we do have a few showroom partners who have our products on display for you to try out.  Please click on the the link to see a list of all our partners.

settings.question: Do airweave products have a warranty?
settings.answer:
Airweave provides a limited warranty up to 10 years on our Mattress, Mattress Advanced, New airweave Mattress, and New airweave Mattress Advanced.

Airweave provides a limited warranty up to 3 years on our Top Mattress, Top Mattress Luxe, Futon, Portable, and our Ritz Paris Collection models (Portable and Traveler). 

Airweave provides a 1 year warranty on the airfiber® inserts of the S-Line Pillow.

Airweave does not provide a warranty for our Seat Cushion, Pillow, and Hyperdown Duvets.

To review each warranty, please click here.

settings.question: How will I know when my order ships?
settings.answer: Once your order has a tracking number, it will automatically be sent to you via the email your provided in your order. Depending on the order, please allow 1-7 business days to receive the tracking number. If you do not receive the email after 7 business days, please contact us and we will assist you as soon as possible.

settings.question: When can I expect my order?
settings.answer:
For the airweave Mattress: 10-14 business days

- This is oversized and requires special freight service.
- A representative from our freight service will contact you to schedule the delivery.
- All deliveries must be scheduled Monday - Friday.
- Please allow additional handling time at the warehouse of approximately 5 days. Depending on order volume this could be up to 2 weeks.
- We’ll be sure to make it clear on our product pages if there is an unusual delay due to overwhelming order volume.
- $40 White Glove Service - You also have the option to pay an additional $40 for white glove service which will provide you with a scheduled delivery and setup within your home.

Can I get Saturday Delivery? If you are curious about Saturday delivery, please contact us and we can see if your local freight dispatch can accommodate along with a price quote. In the event that we can offer this service, there is an additional fee that we will need to send an invoice for prior to finalizing the delivery appointment.

For all other products (including the Mattress Advanced): 1-7 business days.

- These are considered standard size and are shipped via parcel services such as FedEx or UPS.

- Any orders shipping parcel that are placed before 5am EST will ship same-day.

- Orders considered parcel shipments placed after 5am EST will ship next day.

- Once the order leaves our warehouse please expect the shipping to take 1-5 business days.

For multiple items:

- Depending on what the items are, each one will ship as described above.

airweave.com currently can only ship every product within the 48 contiguous states but we are working on expanding! Please sign up for our newsletter to be the first to know when we begin shipping elsewhere.

Hawaii: we can ship certain products (not airweave Mattress) via FedEx. Please get in touch with us with the item, size and your address so we can get you a shipping quote. Free shipping does not apply.

For Taiwan, visit http://airweave.tw/

For China, visit http://airweave.cn/

settings.question: What should I do if I only received a partial shipment?
settings.answer: It is possible your shipment was split based on product availability, and that the missing items will be shipped when they become available. Please contact us at 1-800-407-1500 from 9 AM - 5 PM EST Monday - Friday to report an incomplete shipment, and we will check the status of your missing items. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

settings.question: What should I do if I think my shipment is lost?
settings.answer: Please contact us at 1-800-407-1500 from 9 AM - 5 PM EST Monday - Friday, and we will initiate a thorough search of your shipment with the transit company.

settings.question: What should I do if my shipment arrived damaged?
settings.answer:
If your order was damaged in-transit please contact us at 

1-800-407-1500 from 9 AM - 5 PM EST Monday - Friday to report a damaged shipment. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

settings.question: Why am I seeing a recycling fee when I check out?
settings.answer:
Certain states require retailers to collect a small fee at checkout for each mattress sold to fund their recycling efforts. 

States include California ($10.50), Connecticut ($9.00) and Rhode Island ($16.00). The fees are transferred to the state and mandated by law. The Mattress Recycling Council (MRC), a nonprofit organization established by the mattress industry, created and manages the program. The MRC utilizes a network of organizations to effectively pickup, transport and recycle old mattresses within government regulations. Learn more.

settings.question: What is the airweave return policy?
settings.answer:
We want to ensure your complete satisfaction. In many cases, it can take up to 30 days for your body to adjust to the feeling of your new mattress. That's why we give you ample time to try your mattress with our 100-night trial. Try our mattresses, toppers, futon, portable or traveler for a minimum of 30 nights and if you are not completely satisfied you are eligible for a full refund in the form of the original payment as long as you get in touch within 100 days from when your item was delivered.

For the airweave Hyperdown, Dog Bed, Seat Cushion & pillows you have 30 days to request a return and item must be in new condition with all tags attached. These items are subject to return fees. See return policies for details.

settings.question: When can I expect my refund?
settings.answer: Please expect a refund within 5-7 days after the removal service of your airweave product(s).

settings.question: What is the return policy if I purchased an airweave product not from airweave.com?
settings.answer: For purchases made on Amazon or Rakuten we do not offer a 100 night trial. All products must be returned unused, in new condition. A $100 restocking fee applies to any Mattress, Futon or Topper. For any other third party retailer you may have purchased from, please contact the company for details on their policies.

settings.heading: Product Comparison
settings.subheading: Every mattress and topper is uniquely firm and supportive, but with varying features to meet your needs. Learn more about our customizable beds, the feel of our mattresses and more.

settings.caption: airweave MattressFit is an industry-first technology designed to improve sleep through body measurement analysis to achieve proper sleep posture.
Just 5 minutes & 2 photos is all it takes to get your ideal mattress configuration for our New airweave Mattress Advanced
One firmness throughout the mattress will never satisfy the needs of every individual's body type. With the New Mattress Advanced and MattressFit you'll achieve proper spine alignment.
Our research shows that proper spine alignment and sleep posture reduces the amount of energy exerted while sleeping (when you roll over) so you wake up more refreshed.

settings.heading: New Tech For Better Sleep
settings.text: airweave MattressFit is a web-based app for body measurement analysis, developed to provide our customers with personalized mattress configurations  for the New Airweave Mattress Advanced. A smartphone and someone on-hand to take 2 photos of you is all you need to begin.

settings.title: Wake Up With Less Pain
settings.text: The firm supportive feel of airfiber¬Æ helps maintain the body's natural posture better than on a soft mattress like memory foam. 70% of customers choose airweave due to back and joint pain.

settings.title: Cooler For Deeper Sleep
settings.text: Airfiber¬Æ is proven to lower core body temperature faster so you fall into a deeper sleep faster. Deep sleep on airfiber¬Æ has been proven to be 308% longer than sleeping on memory foam.

settings.title: Re-energizing & Refreshing
settings.text: We all naturally turn-over while sleeping, but only airweave helps you do that with ease. With 53 - 66% less muscle activity than sleeping on memory foam, you'll notice the difference when you wake up and feel more refreshed instead of tired.

settings.title: A Cleaner Mattress
settings.text: airfiber¬Æ  does not attract mold, dust mites or even bedbugs. And as the only 100% washable mattress, airweave allows you to sleep with less dust and germs. You can breathe easier, rest easier, and wake up more refreshed.

settings.title: Extra Warm
settings.text: Extra warmth is created through hygroscopic heat build up, the ability to convert moisture into heat, thanks to our innovative Hyperdown fill. When combined with an outer shell designed to provide the highest level of insulation, this is the perfect duvet for cooler temperatures.

settings.title: Humidity Control
settings.text: Most duvets trap heat and moisture leaving you tossing and turning uncomfortably due to a high level of humidity. Hyperdown is able to take moisture and convert it into heat leaving you comfortably warm and sound asleep.

settings.title: Healthy
settings.text: While natural down can attract dirt, microbes, and cause allergies, Hyperdown is antimicrobial, hypoallergenic, and even controls odors. Wash easily by hand or dry clean.

settings.title: Humane
settings.text: We support cruelty-free bedding and, as a company built on innovation, are proud to develop an alternative that is superior to natural down.

settings.heading: Why Modular?
settings.video_one_title: How To Set Up the New Mattress Advanced
settings.info_one_copy: Choose what feels right for your body and sleep preferences. Our New Advanced Mattress offers Soft, Moderate, and Firm options as well as 2 pillow top layers to add additional plushness.
settings.info_two_title: Easier To Move, Easier To Clean
settings.info_two_copy: Lightweight modular design makes it easier to carry and wash your mattress. Great for frequent movers and a nod to traditional Japanese futon culture which is designed to be easily stored when not in use.
settings.info_three_copy: Enjoy Airweave for a lifetime by easily replacing parts rather than having to buy (or throw out) your entire mattress. A win for your wallet and the environment.
settings.info_four_title: A Better Bed In A Box
settings.info_four_copy: We ship the New Advanced in 3 small boxes (62‚Äùx 17‚Äùx 29.5‚Äù). Assembles in minutes and it‚Äôs ready to sleep on!  There‚Äôs no wait time for decompression and no off-gassing.

settings.heading: DUAL MODE TECHNOLOGY
settings.features_heading: Easily Flip & Rotate To Adjust Firmness
settings.features_content: DUAL MODE is our engineering technology that produces a different firmness on either side our airfiber¬Æ material. The New Advanced is equipped with 3 DUAL MODE airfiber¬Æ blocks and 3 firmness levels to choose from (Soft, Moderate, Firm).

settings.heading: DUAL MODE TECHNOLOGY
settings.features_heading: Regular or Firm? Easily flip your DUAL MODE block to Choose
settings.features_content: Each Advanced mattress comes with 1 DUAL MODE airfiber block. Flip to the 'Firm Side' for the highest level of back support & spine alignment. Flip to the 'Regular Side' for a just a little more give.

settings.content: Airfiber is our proprietary technology and material that makes up the core of our mattresses. Through its unique interwoven design, airfiber helps you move easily, evenly distributes weight and allows airflow to help keep you in a deeper more restful sleep.
